alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 09 at 2:47PM MST until March 10 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FRIDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES, AND RECEPTIVE FUEL CONDITIONS... .Southwest winds will strengthen over the northeast highlands on Friday with low humidity, above normal temperatures, and very dry fuels in place. Critical fire weather conditions are possible for several hours during the afternoon along the I-25 corridor from near Las Vegas to Raton. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Friday morning through Friday afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) late Friday morning through Friday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts near 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...15 to 19%. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
